description: Templates for creating adoption events in adoption-history.jsonl

sap_installed.description: SAP reaches Level 1 - Basic infrastructure operational

template.notes: Brief description of L1 infrastructure: key files, scripts, configs installed

example.notes: A-MEM system installed: .chora/memory/ directory with 4 memory types, 3 event logs operational

level_progression_L1_to_L2.description: SAP progresses from Level 1 to Level 2 - Production usage with metrics

template.evidence: Specific evidence of L2 adoption: metrics, production usage, baseline established
template.notes: Brief summary of L2 achievements and ROI

example.evidence: Baseline established: 150+ files, 1,200+ links, 4 broken (0.3%), <5s scan time
example.notes: Production testing completed, broken links identified for remediation

level_progression_L2_to_L3.description: SAP progresses from Level 2 to Level 3 - Full automation and strategic impact

template.evidence: Specific evidence of L3 adoption: CI/CD integration, automation, template propagation, high ROI
template.notes: Brief summary of L3 achievements, ROI calculation (e.g., 16-23x), strategic impact

example.evidence: Complete CI/CD lifecycle: release.yml (OIDC publishing), docs-quality.yml (SAP-016), 8 workflows, template propagation
example.notes: Full automation operational, 16-23x ROI (16h saved/month conservative, 23h optimistic)

awareness_files_created.description: Phase 1 awareness files created for a SAP (AGENTS.md, CLAUDE.md)

template.notes: Phase 1 awareness files for SAP (brief description of capability)

example.notes: Phase 1 awareness files for documentation framework (Diataxis, frontmatter, test extraction)

template.notes: Description of milestone achievement and impact

example.notes: Achieved 100% SAP awareness coverage - all 29 SAPs now have Phase 1 awareness files (AGENTS.md + CLAUDE.md)

usage_instructions.sap_installed: 1. Copy template, 2. Replace SAP-XXX with actual SAP ID, 3. Set sap_name, 4. Set timestamp (use `date -u +"%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%SZ"`), 5. Set hours_invested, 6. Write descriptive notes about L1 infrastructure
usage_instructions.level_progression_L1_to_L2: 1. Copy template, 2. Replace SAP-XXX, 3. Set timestamp, 4. Set hours_invested (incremental) and cumulative_hours (total), 5. Provide specific evidence of L2 (metrics, production usage), 6. Calculate ROI if applicable
usage_instructions.level_progression_L2_to_L3: 1. Copy template, 2. Replace SAP-XXX, 3. Set timestamp, 4. Set hours_invested and cumulative_hours, 5. Provide L3 evidence (automation, CI/CD), 6. Calculate ROI (X hours saved/month / Y hours maintenance)
usage_instructions.awareness_files_created: 1. Copy template, 2. Replace SAP-XXX, 3. Set timestamp, 4. Set files_created (typically ["AGENTS.md", "CLAUDE.md"]), 5. Count workflows and lines, 6. Estimate hours (typically 1-2h per SAP)
usage_instructions.milestone: 1. Copy template, 2. Set milestone name (use snake_case), 3. Set timestamp, 4. Set coverage (e.g., "29/29"), 5. Calculate percentage, 6. Describe achievement

time_savings.before: 12 minutes per adoption event (manual JSON writing, format checking)
time_savings.after: 2 minutes per adoption event (copy template, fill placeholders)
time_savings.roi: For 50 adoption events: 500 minutes saved (8.3 hours)
